title: Album Page, "Timbered Buildings on River Bank", September 10, 1887
medium: Graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: recto, in graphite, at upper left corner: (written perpendicular to binding): 47; at upper right corner (written parallel to binding and inscribed in a circle): 35 / (written below drawing perpendicular to binding): Strassburg / Sept 10th 1887
description: Horizontal sheet tipped vertically into binding.  Illustrated is a large, square timbered building with two arcaded stories enclosed by a railing of crossed timbers.  This building is on the bank of a river, its lower story having two windows flanking a door which opens directly onto the water.  Three small wooden piles outside the door allow a boat to be moored next to the structure.  A railing lines the riverbank at right, and the elevations of similar structures are seen in the background.

tombstone.epitaph:
Album Page, "Timbered Buildings on River Bank", September 10, 1887.
September 10, 1887. Graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-116.
